meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of lipids.
meanings.sent1: The lipidic nature of the cell membrane helps regulate what goes in and out.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the lipidic composition of different types of fats.
meanings.sent3: The lipidic salad dressing was so thick, it almost seemed like a spread.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a lipidic shine to it, resembling the glossy surface of oils.
meanings.sent5: The lipidic smell of the buttery croissants filled the bakery with a rich aroma.

meanings.sent1: The lipidic foods like avocados and nuts are good sources of healthy fats.
meanings.sent2: The lipidic layer of the skin helps maintain moisture and protect the body.
meanings.sent3: The lipidic ice cream was so creamy and indulgent, it was hard to resist.
meanings.sent4: The pond had a lipidic surface, with oil droplets floating on the water.
meanings.sent5: The lipidic texture of the lotion made it perfect for dry skin, leaving it soft and smooth.

meanings.sent1: The lipidic clouds in the sky looked like fluffy layers of fat.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a lipidic landscape, with rolling hills that seemed to flow like oil.
meanings.sent3: The lipidic sculpture had a smooth, shiny surface that mimicked the look of oils.
meanings.sent4: The lake had a lipidic appearance, reflecting the colors of the sunset like a mirror.
meanings.sent5: The lipidic texture of the fabric made it look like it was made of liquid.
